p: Clinically a person is declared a suspect case of measles when he has a generalized maculopapular rash and fever, with cough and/or coryza, and/or conjunctivitis [ 3]. Once the disease progresses, the immunosuppression caused by measles virus (MeV) exposes the patient to bacterial super infections causing otitis media, pneumonia, or gastrointestinal infections. The main cause of measles-related morbidity and mortality is due to association of these symptoms with other factors such as malnutrition and vitamin A deficiency [ 4].
